data.text:
@CryptoXpo @Unikorn_77 @victoria_potter @pfizer The variants, which are still going around because the virus is still going around, change. Omicron took everybody by surprise.
But,please understand that as this insidious virus still goes around it can mutate anytime, anywhere. Vaccines are one of the only defenses that we have
@Unikorn_77 @hazeleyes198414 @victoria_potter @pfizer Or is it because the “booster” wasn’t rolled out in time? Because the first 2 was ineffective ?

@Unikorn_77 @hazeleyes198414 @victoria_potter @pfizer Deaths went down in the warmer months as what happens with the common flu, then shot back up in the winter even though vaccines had been rolled out for months by that point?
@victoria_potter @pfizer Have you never read the side effects of a drug or vaccine before?

@JPablee I don't disagree that the rules don't always make sense. Personally I think people with antibodies should be treated like vaccinated, and a negative test suffices in many cases and it is expected in place of being vaccinated here

@CanadianDev But if I’m not infected, how can I infect others?

Let’s say it’s more probable that I’m infected, wouldn’t a negative test suffice?

Wouldn’t proof of antibodies from previous contraction be sufficient?

None of this is logical. That’s my issue.
